 12#define VSIP_CORE_REDUCTIONS_REDUCTIONS_HPP

 14#include <vsip/support.hpp>
 15#include <vsip/vector.hpp>
 16#include <vsip/matrix.hpp>
 17#include <vsip/tensor.hpp>
 18#include <vsip/core/reductions/functors.hpp>
 19#include <vsip/core/parallel/services.hpp>
 20#include <vsip/core/dispatch.hpp>
 21#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
 22# include <vsip/opt/reductions/reductions.hpp>
 23#endif
 24#if VSIP_IMPL_HAVE_CVSIP
 25# include <vsip/core/cvsip/eval_reductions.hpp>
 26#endif
 27
 28namespace vsip
 29{
 30namespace impl
 31{
 32
 33template <template <typename> class ReduceT,
 34	  typename                  ViewT>
 35typename ReduceT<typename ViewT::value_type>::result_type
 36reduce(ViewT v)
 37{
 38  using namespace vsip_csl::dispatcher;
 39
 40  typedef typename ViewT::value_type T;
 41  typedef typename ReduceT<T>::result_type result_type;
 42  typedef typename ViewT::block_type block_type;
 43  typedef typename Block_layout<typename ViewT::block_type>::order_type
 44    order_type;
 45  typedef Int_type<ViewT::dim> dim_type;
 46
 47  result_type r;
 48
 49#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
 50  Evaluator<op::reduce<ReduceT>, be::cvsip, 
 51    void(result_type&, block_type const&, order_type, dim_type)>::
 52    exec(r, v.block(), order_type(), dim_type());
 53#else
 54
 55  // Don't use the default dispatch list here, as that doesn't include the
 56  // 'parallel' backend. (The latter then uses the default list for local
 57  // dispatches.
 58  typedef Make_type_list<be::parallel,
 59                         be::cbe_sdk,
 60                         be::cvsip,
 61                         be::mercury_sal, 
 62                         be::generic>::type list_type;
 63
 64  Dispatcher<op::reduce<ReduceT>, 
 65    void(result_type&, block_type const&, order_type, dim_type), list_type>::
 66    dispatch(r, v.block(), order_type(), dim_type());
 67#endif
 68
 69  return r;
 70}
 71
 72} // namespace vsip::impl
 73
 74template <typename                            T,
 75	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
 76	  typename                            BlockT>
 77typename impl::All_true<T>::result_type
 78alltrue(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
 79{
 80  return impl::reduce<impl::All_true>(v);
 81}
 82
 83template <typename                            T,
 84	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
 85	  typename                            BlockT>
 86typename impl::Any_true<T>::result_type
 87anytrue(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
 88{
 89  return impl::reduce<impl::Any_true>(v);
 90}
 91
 92template <typename                            T,
 93	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
 94	  typename                            BlockT>
 95typename impl::Mean_value<T>::result_type
 96meanval(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
 97{
 98  return impl::reduce<impl::Mean_value>(v);
 99}
100
101// Note: meansqval computes the mean of the magnitude square
102
103template <typename                            T,
104	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
105	  typename                            BlockT>
106typename impl::Mean_magsq_value<T>::result_type
107meansqval(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
108{
109  return impl::reduce<impl::Mean_magsq_value>(v);
110}
111
112template <typename                            T,
113	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
114	  typename                            BlockT>
115typename impl::Sum_value<T>::result_type
116sumval(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
117{
118  return impl::reduce<impl::Sum_value>(v);
119}
120
121template <typename                            T,
122	  template <typename, typename> class ViewT,
123	  typename                            BlockT>
124typename impl::Sum_sq_value<T>::result_type
125sumsqval(ViewT<T, BlockT> v)
126{
127  return impl::reduce<impl::Sum_sq_value>(v);
128}
